trans-unit.source: Update Rental Contract Prices

seg-source.mrk: Update Rental Contract Prices

trans-unit.source: The “Update Rental Contract Prices” batch job is used to update prices on rental contracts that need price updates. This batch job can also be used to print a test report.

seg-source.mrk: The “Update Rental Contract Prices” batch job is used to update prices on rental contracts that need price updates.
This batch job can also be used to print a test report.

trans-unit.source: : Update Rental Contract Prices batch job

seg-source.mrk: : Update Rental Contract Prices batch job

trans-unit.source: When the batch job is run to update contract prices, the program updates the contract value of rental items as specified and recalculates relevant amounts on the rental contract and on the rental items included.

seg-source.mrk: When the batch job is run to update contract prices, the program updates the contract value of rental items as specified and recalculates relevant amounts on the rental contract and on the rental items included.

trans-unit.source: The fields on the Options FastTab are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The fields on the Options FastTab are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Field

seg-source.mrk: Field

trans-unit.source: Description

seg-source.mrk: Description

trans-unit.source: Update To Date

seg-source.mrk: Update To Date

trans-unit.source: Date up to which the prices are to be updated. The batch job will include contracts with next price update dates on or before this date.

seg-source.mrk: Date up to which the prices are to be updated.
The batch job will include contracts with next price update dates on or before this date.

trans-unit.source: Price Update %

seg-source.mrk: Price Update %

trans-unit.source: Price update for the rental item contract values in percentages.

seg-source.mrk: Price update for the rental item contract values in percentages.

trans-unit.source: Action

seg-source.mrk: Action

trans-unit.source: Determines the action that occurs when the batch job is run:

seg-source.mrk: Determines the action that occurs when the batch job is run:

trans-unit.source: Update Contract Prices – Performs the price update.

seg-source.mrk: Update Contract Prices – Performs the price update.

trans-unit.source: Print Only – Prints a test report based on the selected criteria. This report shows the contract numbers, customer numbers, contract amounts, price update percentages and any errors that occur.

seg-source.mrk: Print Only – Prints a test report based on the selected criteria.
This report shows the contract numbers, customer numbers, contract amounts, price update percentages and any errors that occur.

trans-unit.source: The price updates depend on the formula in the Price Update Period field of the Service Contract Template, which is assigned in the Rental Mgt. Setup page. This information is automatically transferred to the Next Price Update Date and Price Update Period fields on the rent order line.

seg-source.mrk: The price updates depend on the formula in the Price Update Period field of the Service Contract Template, which is assigned in the Rental Mgt.
Setup page.
This information is automatically transferred to the Next Price Update Date and Price Update Period fields on the rent order line.

trans-unit.source: The date in the Next Price Update Date field on the rent order line must be reached before a change can be made to a price using this batch job. This date can be adjusted manually by entering a new date or changing the date formula in the Price Update Period field. Both of these fields, and the Last Price Update Date and Last Price Update % fields, must be displayed using the “Choose Columns” function.

seg-source.mrk: The date in the Next Price Update Date field on the rent order line must be reached before a change can be made to a price using this batch job.
This date can be adjusted manually by entering a new date or changing the date formula in the Price Update Period field.
Both of these fields, and the Last Price Update Date and Last Price Update % fields, must be displayed using the “Choose Columns” function.

trans-unit.source: After running the function, the Last Price Update Date and Last Price Update % fields on the lines display the updated values.

seg-source.mrk: After running the function, the Last Price Update Date and Last Price Update % fields on the lines display the updated values.

trans-unit.source: The Rental Line Price History page displays all price changes that have been made, by running the batch job or by manually changing the price on the line after shipping, but prior to invoicing. Manual changes to line discount percentages are also stored in this page.

seg-source.mrk: The Rental Line Price History page displays all price changes that have been made, by running the batch job or by manually changing the price on the line after shipping, but prior to invoicing.
Manual changes to line discount percentages are also stored in this page.

trans-unit.source: The values in this page are also used to recalculate the total price on the rent order.

seg-source.mrk: The values in this page are also used to recalculate the total price on the rent order.

trans-unit.source: : Rental Line Price History with manual line discount and price change prior to invoicing

seg-source.mrk: : Rental Line Price History with manual line discount and price change prior to invoicing

trans-unit.source: Based on the above criteria, calculations are made as follows:

seg-source.mrk: Based on the above criteria, calculations are made as follows:

trans-unit.source: If no invoicing has occurred, then the total rental time is recalculated.

seg-source.mrk: If no invoicing has occurred, then the total rental time is recalculated.

trans-unit.source: If a portion of a rent order has been invoiced, the system uses the price validity periods to calculate the total price.

seg-source.mrk: If a portion of a rent order has been invoiced, the system uses the price validity periods to calculate the total price.

trans-unit.source: For example, in a year-long contract, if two months were invoiced each at 100.00 and three months each at 120.00, and the new price is 130.00, then the system calculates the remaining seven months each at 130.00; there is no pricing adjustment to the previously invoiced periods, even if the invoices are un-posted.

seg-source.mrk: For example, in a year-long contract, if two months were invoiced each at 100.00 and three months each at 120.00, and the new price is 130.00, then the system calculates the remaining seven months each at 130.00; there is no pricing adjustment to the previously invoiced periods, even if the invoices are un-posted.

trans-unit.source: Exercise – Run the Update Rental Contract Prices Batch Job

seg-source.mrk: Exercise – Run the Update Rental Contract Prices Batch Job

trans-unit.source: On December 31, 2018, you receive a prepaid rent order from customer R-30000 for the 2019 time frame, to be paid in half year periods. As you create the order, you inform the customer that as of January 1, 2019, a 5% rate increase becomes effective, and that on July 1, 2019, a 2.5% rate increase will also occur. The customer accepts these terms and you process the orders after the accounting manager runs the “Update Rental Contract Prices” batch job as of January 1st and July 1st.

seg-source.mrk: On December 31, 2018, you receive a prepaid rent order from customer R-30000 for the 2019 time frame, to be paid in half year periods.
As you create the order, you inform the customer that as of January 1, 2019, a 5% rate increase becomes effective, and that on July 1, 2019, a 2.5% rate increase will also occur.
The customer accepts these terms and you process the orders after the accounting manager runs the “Update Rental Contract Prices” batch job as of January 1st and July 1st.

trans-unit.source: Create and Ship the Prepaid Rent Order

seg-source.mrk: Create and Ship the Prepaid Rent Order

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to create and ship the rent order:

seg-source.mrk: Follow these steps to create and ship the rent order:

trans-unit.source: Set the Work Date to 12/31/18.

seg-source.mrk: Set the Work Date to 12/31/18.

trans-unit.source: Insert a new rent order for customer R-30000.

seg-source.mrk: Insert a new rent order for customer R-30000.

trans-unit.source: On the Lines FastTab, use the “Choose Columns” function to show the Next Price Update Date, Price Update Period, Last Price Update Date, and Last Price Update % fields.

seg-source.mrk: On the Lines FastTab, use the “Choose Columns” function to show the Next Price Update Date, Price Update Period, Last Price Update Date, and Last Price Update % fields.

trans-unit.source:
In the lines, enter the following:
  1. Type = Item
  2. No. = R-30000-01
  3. Quantity = 1
  4. Rental Rate Code = Month
  5. Invoice Period = Half Year
  6. Prepaid = Yes
  7. Rental Start Date = 01/01/19
  8. Rental End Date = 12/31/19
  9. Price Update Period = 6M
  10. Next Price Update Date = 01/01/19

seg-source.mrk: In the lines, enter the following:<ol start="1">
• Type = Item
<li class="ccTextvorlageNumberedList">No.
• Quantity = 1
• Rental Rate Code = Month
• Invoice Period = Half Year
• Prepaid = Yes
• Rental Start Date = 01/01/19
• Rental End Date = 12/31/19
• Price Update Period = 6M
• Next Price Update Date = 01/01/19

trans-unit.source:
Notice that the:
  • Rate Unit Price field is 350.00
  • Unit Price Total Rental Time and Amount Total Rental Time fields are 4200.00 (350 rate * 12 months)

seg-source.mrk: Notice that the:
• Rate Unit Price field is 350.00
• Unit Price Total Rental Time and Amount Total Rental Time fields are 4200.00 (350 rate * 12 months)

trans-unit.source: : Rent order with pricing update fields

seg-source.mrk: : Rent order with pricing update fields

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click Post.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click Post.

trans-unit.source: With the Ship option selected, click OK.

seg-source.mrk: With the Ship option selected, click OK.

trans-unit.source: Close the Rent Order.

seg-source.mrk: Close the Rent Order.

trans-unit.source: Run the Update Rental Contract Prices Batch Job

seg-source.mrk: Run the Update Rental Contract Prices Batch Job

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to run the batch job:

seg-source.mrk: Follow these steps to run the batch job:

trans-unit.source: In the navigation pane, under cc|rental, click Periodic Activities > Update Rental Contract Prices.

seg-source.mrk: In the navigation pane, under cc|rental, click Periodic Activities > Update Rental Contract Prices.

trans-unit.source: In the Update To Date field, enter 01/01/19.

seg-source.mrk: In the Update To Date field, enter 01/01/19.

trans-unit.source: In the Price Update % field, enter 5.

seg-source.mrk: In the Price Update % field, enter 5.

trans-unit.source: Click OK to run the batch job.

seg-source.mrk: Click OK to run the batch job.

trans-unit.source:
Open the previously created rent order and notice that the:
  • Rate Unit Price field is 367.50 (350 old rate * 5% = 17.5)
  • Unit Price Total Rental Time and Amount Total Rental Time fields are 4410.00 (367.50 new rate * 12 months)
  • Next Price Update Date field is 7/1/2019, based on the date calculation in the Price Update Period field
  • Last Price Update Date and Last Price Update % fields show the updated information

seg-source.mrk: Open the previously created rent order and notice that the:
• Rate Unit Price field is 367.50 (350 old rate * 5% = 17.5)
• Unit Price Total Rental Time and Amount Total Rental Time fields are 4410.00 (367.50 new rate * 12 months)
• Next Price Update Date field is 7/1/2019, based on the date calculation in the Price Update Period field
• Last Price Update Date and Last Price Update % fields show the updated information

trans-unit.source: : Updated rental prices

seg-source.mrk: : Updated rental prices

trans-unit.source: On the Lines FastTab, click Line > Show Price History.

seg-source.mrk: On the Lines FastTab, click Line > Show Price History.

trans-unit.source: : Pricing update in the Rental Line Price History page

seg-source.mrk: : Pricing update in the Rental Line Price History page

trans-unit.source: Escape back to the rent order.

seg-source.mrk: Escape back to the rent order.

trans-unit.source: Invoice the Order

seg-source.mrk: Invoice the Order

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to invoice the order:

seg-source.mrk: Follow these steps to invoice the order:

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click Post.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click Post.

trans-unit.source: Select the Invoice option and then click OK.

seg-source.mrk: Select the Invoice option and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: In the Posting Date field enter 01/01/19.

seg-source.mrk: In the Posting Date field enter 01/01/19.

trans-unit.source: In the Invoice to Date field, enter 06/30/19.

seg-source.mrk: In the Invoice to Date field, enter 06/30/19.

trans-unit.source: Click OK to create the invoice and then accept all confirmation messages.

seg-source.mrk: Click OK to create the invoice and then accept all confirmation messages.

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click Navigate > Invoices.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click Navigate > Invoices.

trans-unit.source: Open the invoice and notice that the line, totaling 2205.00 (4410.00 invoice total / 2 for the half year), is to be posted to the Rental Prepayment Account (5792).

seg-source.mrk: Open the invoice and notice that the line, totaling 2205.00 (4410.00 invoice total / 2 for the half year), is to be posted to the Rental Prepayment Account (5792).

trans-unit.source: : Invoice for rent order with updated pricing

seg-source.mrk: : Invoice for rent order with updated pricing

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click Post and then click Yes to post the invoice.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click Post and then click Yes to post the invoice.

trans-unit.source: Close the open pages.

seg-source.mrk: Close the open pages.

trans-unit.source: Run the Update Rental Contract Prices Batch Job

seg-source.mrk: Run the Update Rental Contract Prices Batch Job

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to run the batch job:

seg-source.mrk: Follow these steps to run the batch job:

trans-unit.source: Change the Work Date to 06/30/19.

seg-source.mrk: Change the Work Date to 06/30/19.

trans-unit.source: In the navigation pane, under cc|rental, click Periodic Activities > Update Rental Contract Prices.

seg-source.mrk: In the navigation pane, under cc|rental, click Periodic Activities > Update Rental Contract Prices.

trans-unit.source: In the Update To Date field, enter 07/01/19.

seg-source.mrk: In the Update To Date field, enter 07/01/19.

trans-unit.source: In the Price Update % field, enter 2.5.

seg-source.mrk: In the Price Update % field, enter 2.5.

trans-unit.source: Click OK.

seg-source.mrk: Click OK.

trans-unit.source:
Open the previously created rent order and notice that the:
  • Rate Unit Price field is 376.69 (367.50 old rate + 2.5%)
  • Unit Price Total Rental Time and Amount Total Rental Time fields are 4465.14 (Six months at old rate of 367.50 (2205.00) + Six months at new rate of 376.69 (2260.14))
  • Next Price Update Date field is 1/1/2020, based on the date calculation in the Price Update Period field
  • Last Price Update Date and Last Price Update % fields show the latest update information

seg-source.mrk: Open the previously created rent order and notice that the:
• Rate Unit Price field is 376.69 (367.50 old rate + 2.5%)
• Unit Price Total Rental Time and Amount Total Rental Time fields are 4465.14 (Six months at old rate of 367.50 (2205.00) + Six months at new rate of 376.69 (2260.14))
• Next Price Update Date field is 1/1/2020, based on the date calculation in the Price Update Period field
• Last Price Update Date and Last Price Update % fields show the latest update information

trans-unit.source: : Invoice for rent order with updated pricing

seg-source.mrk: : Invoice for rent order with updated pricing

trans-unit.source: On the Lines FastTab, click Line > Show Price History.
